author: Ren Venkatesh
title: Scientists sound the alarm as vanishing coastlines put major cities at risk: 'We can't just stand here and let the water take us' - NewsBreak
text: As sea levels continue to rise around the world, coastal communities and infrastructure have begun to feel the effects. Among these regions is Canada's Vancouver Island, the site of increasingly intense storms and flooding, reported Goldstream News Gazette . Due to rising temperatures, ice sheets are starting to melt, bringing ocean waters higher and putting coastal communities at risk. Currently, the Oak Bay municipality on Vancouver Island faces the greatest flooding threat, with most of its shoreline barely above sea level. "Rising sea levels, more intense storms, and eroding shorelines are no longer distant threats — they're happening now," warned Kevin Laird of British Columbia's Goldstream News Gazette. Per the article, coastal sea levels are set to experience a rise of around half a meter (1.6 feet) by 2050, and a total of 1.3 meters (4.3 feet) by 2100 — "enough to submerge entire neighborhoods," Laird wrote . While flooding in these regions may not have been uncommon in the past, rising sea levels and warmer ocean waters make these events more frequent and more extreme , putting lives and infrastructure at risk. Most coastal infrastructure wasn't built to withstand the current state of oceans and storms, per the Goldstream News. Sea levels today aren't the same as they were even 20 years ago, and extreme storms can now flood entire basements within a few minutes. While coastal communities such as several Vancouver municipalities have started taking preparation measures such as sea-level mapping, risk assessments, and stricter zoning regulations, significant infrastructure protections have so far proven difficult to enact and slow to take effect. Meanwhile, insurance coverage of flood-based disasters has begun to fall, putting homeowners in these flood-prone regions under both physical and financial duress. It sounds like something out of a dystopia — but if the coasts continue to erode away and move more inland, submerging cities in the years to come, we all will eventually face the same threat. To protect our coastal regions, we need to mitigate the melting of ice sheets by preventing global temperatures from rising any further. As planetary overheating stems primarily from carbon pollution , swapping our dirty fuel-based energy consumption for renewable energy sources like wind and solar would be a step in the right direction. "We can't just stand here and let the water take us," remarked one coastal citizen, per Goldstream News Gazette . "We need the province, the feds — everybody — to step up." Do you think your house could withstand a hurricane? No way Maybe a weak one I'm not sure It definitely could Click your choice to see results and speak your mind. If your community is experiencing an imminent coastal threat, try putting pressure on your local government to fund new infrastructure and take eco-conscious municipal measures. Join our free newsletter for good news and useful tips , and don't miss this cool list of easy ways to help yourself while helping the planet. first appeared on .

author: TitereConCabeza
title: Ayuso renueva los contratos con la empresa que sirvió comida podrida en residencias
text:
Ayuso renueva los contratos con la empresa que sirvió comida podrida en residencias
por a enviado:
La comida podrida seguirá llegando a los centros de menores y residencias de mayores de la Comunidad de Madrid. Según ha avanzado el diario Público, el Gobierno de Isabel Díaz Ayuso, lejos de revocar o dejar caer los contratos con empresas que acumulan denuncias por la mala calidad de sus servicios desde 2022, ha prorrogado la vinculación con la Plataforma Femar S.L., una firma que incluso fue sancionada por la CNMC, junto a otras, por establecer cárteles que se repartían los suministros a hospitales, residencias y otros centros de la región.
|

aquí.

author: Rafael Fernández
title: Madrid activa el nivel 2 de riesgo alto por ola de frío: estas son las precauciones a adoptar
text:
Previsión
Madrid activa el nivel 2 de riesgo alto por ola de frío: estas son las precauciones a adoptar
Brumas y nieblas extensas por la mañana en toda la región
Todo preparado ante la próxima Cabalgata de Reyes, especialmente los abrigos, pues el frío estará asegurado. La Comunidad de Madrid mantiene activo el nivel de 2 de riesgo alto ante ola de frío en los próximos días, con mínimas previstas para este viernes que alcanzarán los -0,3 grados.
El nivel de riesgo por ola de frío se establece en función de las predicciones de la Agencia Estatal de Meteorología (Aemet) y se calcula mediante una fórmula en la que se tiene en cuenta las temperaturas mínimas para los próximos 3 días.
En concreto, la temperatura mínima registrada esta madrugada fue de 0,1º. De cara al viernes se prevé llegar a -0,3º y subirán a -0,8º el sábado y marcarán 4,6º de cara al domingo, según la evolución prevista para los próximos días.
Esta medida se encuadra en el Plan de Vigilancia y Control de los Efectos del Frío en la Salud, que está en funcionamiento desde el pasado de 1 de diciembre hasta el 31 de marzo de este año. Así, siguiendo los criterios del Protocolo de Olas de Frío se activa la alerta por frío, la primera de esta temporada.
El plan se dirige a los grupos de población más frágiles: personas mayores, recién nacidos y lactantes, enfermos crónicos, ciudadanos sin hogar o personas en situación de precariedad.
El objetivo es "reducir las enfermedades asociadas a los bajos valores térmicos, así como sus efectos perjudiciales. Estos fenómenos meteorológicos agravan las patologías cardiovasculares y respiratorias, los síntomas de las reumáticas y favorecen los resfriados, las infecciones bronquiales y la gripe".
El Plan establece tres niveles que sirven para determinar el nivel de peligro y la posible activación de alertas por ola de frío. Son en función de la temperatura mínima media prevista en los tres días siguientes de los cuatro observatorios de la Agencia Española de Meteorología en la región: normalidad, precaución y riesgo alto. Como novedad este año, este último se establecerá cuando la temperatura mínima se sitúe en el umbral de 1,9 grados centígrados, que es la establecida para la Comunidad de Madrid por la autoridad sanitaria estatal.
Los termómetros oscilarán entre los 1ºC y 8ºC en Madrid; los -2ºC y 7ºC en Alcalá de Henares; los -2ºC y 11ºC Aranjuez; los -1ºC y los 10ºC en Collado Villalba; los -1ºC y los 9ºC en Getafe y los -2ºC y 10ºC en Navalcarnero.
Consejos ante el frío
La Consejería de Sanidad aconseja a la población que antes de salir a la calle se informe de las previsiones meteorológicas. Ante el descenso térmico se recomienda utilizar prendas de abrigo resistentes al viento y a la humedad, y, por debajo de estas, cubrirse con ropa no excesivamente ajustada.
También hay que protegerse adecuadamente la cabeza, así como las manos, por ser zonas sensibles y de mayor pérdida de calor, y llevar calzado resistente al agua y antideslizante para evitar caídas (por posibles placas de hielo), especialmente en el caso de las personas mayores. Asimismo, hay que procurar permanecer seco, ya que la ropa mojada enfría el cuerpo rápidamente.
En general, se recomienda estar pendiente de los ciudadanos que puedan encontrarse en situación de vulnerabilidad en estas fechas. En caso necesario, se aconseja contactar con el 112, los servicios sociales de su ayuntamiento o centros de salud.
La Comunidad de Madrid recuerda, por otra parte, que se debe tener suma precaución con las estufas de leña y gas o braseros, para evitar riesgos de incendios o de intoxicación por monóxido de carbono, asegurando que funcionan correctamente antes de ponerlas en marcha y de que las salidas de aire no están obstruidas. Para garantizar una adecuada protección en el hogar es suficiente mantener una temperatura de 20-22 grados, con buen aislamiento térmico.

author: Daily Times Leader
title: Silverback Chatbot Introduces AI Business Assistant to Enhance Customer Interactions and Efficiency | User | dailytimesleader.com
text:
Silverback Chatbot has unveiled its AI business assistant chatbot, an advanced solution designed to streamline customer interactions, automate responses, and improve overall business efficiency. As companies continue to adopt digital transformation strategies, AI-driven tools such as chatbots are becoming essential in optimizing customer support and business communications.
The AI business assistant chatbot from Silverback Chatbot is built with sophisticated natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning capabilities, allowing it to understand and respond to customer inquiries with a high degree of accuracy. This feature enables businesses to handle customer interactions seamlessly, reducing response times and improving overall satisfaction.
One of the key benefits of the chatbot is its ability to provide 24/7 customer support. Many businesses, particularly small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs), struggle with maintaining around-the-clock assistance due to staffing limitations. With an AI-powered chatbot, companies can ensure that customers receive immediate responses to their inquiries at any time of day, improving accessibility and engagement.
Another advantage of the Silverback Chatbot AI business assistant is its ability to integrate with multiple communication channels. Businesses can deploy the chatbot on their websites, social media platforms, and messaging apps, ensuring a consistent and unified customer experience across all digital touchpoints. This omnichannel capability helps companies manage customer interactions efficiently, regardless of the platform customers use to reach out.
Automation is another significant component of the chatbot's functionality. By handling routine queries such as FAQs, appointment scheduling, order tracking, and basic troubleshooting, the AI business assistant frees up human employees to focus on more complex tasks that require a personalized touch. This increases overall productivity and allows staff to dedicate their time to high-value activities.
In addition to handling direct customer interactions, the chatbot can assist businesses with internal processes. Companies can use it to streamline employee support by automating HR inquiries, IT helpdesk support, and internal communications. This ensures that employees can quickly access the information they need, reducing delays and enhancing operational efficiency.
Security and data privacy are crucial considerations in AI chatbot development, and Silverback Chatbot prioritizes compliance with global data protection regulations. The AI business assistant employs encryption and secure authentication mechanisms to safeguard sensitive customer information, ensuring that businesses can use the chatbot with confidence.
Another notable feature of the chatbot is its continuous learning capability. As it interacts with users, it collects insights and refines its responses, improving accuracy over time. This adaptive learning function ensures that the chatbot remains effective even as customer queries and business requirements evolve.
Customization is also a key aspect of the Silverback Chatbot AI business assistant. Companies can tailor the chatbot’s responses, branding, and workflows to align with their specific business needs. Whether it is an e-commerce platform looking to assist shoppers, a real estate agency managing property inquiries, or a healthcare provider offering appointment scheduling, the chatbot can be adapted to fit various industries.
The implementation of AI chatbots is becoming an industry standard, particularly as businesses seek scalable solutions to enhance efficiency and customer engagement. The Silverback Chatbot AI business assistant represents a step forward in how companies leverage AI to improve interactions and optimize operations.
As businesses navigate an increasingly digital landscape, adopting AI-driven solutions like the Silverback Chatbot AI business assistant can provide a competitive advantage. By automating routine tasks, improving response times, and ensuring a seamless customer experience, companies can enhance both operational efficiency and customer satisfaction.
Silverback Chatbot continues to innovate in the AI-driven customer support space, offering businesses the tools they need to modernize interactions and stay ahead in a rapidly evolving market. With its AI business assistant chatbot, companies can harness the power of artificial intelligence to build stronger relationships with their customers while streamlining their internal processes. Visit https://www.pressadvantage.com/story/76166-silverback-chatbot-highlights-the-evolving-role-of-ai-business-assistant-chatbots-in-modern-customer
###

author: gqlshare
title: 2 new health department Test and Go kiosks up and running
text:
Delaware County officials on Wednesday announced the installation and opening of new Test and Go public health kiosks this week at 69th Street Terminal in Upper Darby and the Delaware County Community College Media Line Road campus in Marple Township.
“Delaware County Council is building a better future for Delaware County, not just focusing on the challenges of today, but the promise of tomorrow,” said Council Vice Chair Richard Womack inside the 69th Street transportation hub Wednesday morning. “We’re working to build a better future for our families, our neighbors and next generations, and we’re doing it by investing in programs and expanding access, eliminating barriers and (meeting) people not where we wish they were, but where they are.”
DCHD spokesperson Matthew Rankin, left, demonstrates the 69th Street kiosk to, from left, Delaware County District Attorney Jack Stollsteimer, County Council Vice Chair Richard Womack and state Sen. Tim Kearney, D-26, Swarthmore. (ALEX ROSE DAILY TIMES) Delaware County Health Department Director Lora Siegmann Werner said the new kiosks bring the total number in the county up to five. The other three are located at the Yeadon Wellness Center, the Keystone First Wellness Center in Chester and the County Government Center in Media.
“We really want to thank all of our partners for their support and enthusiasm that’s helping bring these public health visions to life,” said Werner. “We’re really grateful to Delaware County Community College and SEPTA, for opening a facility and being willing to assist us in reaching residents.”
The kiosks dispense numerous health-related items for free, such as condoms, Narcan nasal spray, emergency blankets, tampons and pads, COVID-19 rapid antigen tests and even laboratory PCR testing for respiratory illnesses and sexually transmitted infections.
The kiosks, first launched in September, are offered through a contract with LTS, formally known as Longview International Technology Solutions, with current costs of about $15,000 per month. Those costs are covered by opioid lawsuit settlement funding, as well as various grants.
Werner said the machines’ stocks are electronically monitored and restocked as needed.
Health department spokesman Matthew Rankin said most of the items can be issued to residents anonymously, but laboratory tests obviously require the user to provide contact information. Those tests are usually collected within 12 hours and results are typically delivered within 24 to 48 hours of drop-off, he said.
“All the items inside are free for all residents to use and since September 2024, we have dispensed nearly 2,000 public health products to our residents, and we just know that will grow after being installed in these high traffic locations,” said Werner. “… I encourage everybody here: Take control of your own health, anytime, on your own terms.”
District Attorney Jack Stollsteimer said the kiosks now also offer free gun locks, a service his office had previously provided through the sheriff’s office and other avenues with limited success.
He said gun safety is a non-partisan issue that everyone agrees needs to be taken seriously and he was happy to report that one lock had already been distributed from the 69th Street kiosk earlier that day.
Delaware County Health Department Director Lora Siegmann Werner discusses the installation of new Test and Go kiosks in Upper Darby and Marple this week. (COURTESY OF DELAWARE COUNTY) Rankin said a total of 16 locks had been dispensed from all machines by Wednesday morning.
Delaware County Community College Director of Safety and Security Matthew Brenner was also on hand for Wednesday’s announcement.
He said the most popular items on campus so far appeared to be first-aid kits, but he was able to provide one of those locks to a young mother after she spoke to him about having a firearm in the house.
The DA’s office had also previously been responsible for distributing Narcan in the county, Stollsteimer said, which the kiosks are also helping get to communities where it is needed, along with drug test strips.
Stollsteimer noted President Donald Trump’s administration recently began promoting a holistic approach to the drug problem in America that encouraged exactly what Delaware County is already doing with Narcan and test strips.
“We are all in the same business of saving people’s lives, so I just want to say to anybody who might be talking to the president in the days to come, Delaware County is already ahead of you. We just need continued funding to keep this program going and to expand it,” he said.
State Sen. Tim Kearney, D-26, Swarthmore, said he has learned during his tenure in elected office that some of the best solutions come from simply listening to what people need and then providing it.
“I’m proud to have played a role in helping secure the location of this Test and Go kiosk because I believe that local and state leaders can come together with a purpose, and when that happens, great things happen and greater benefits are available to our constituents,” he said. “Access to health care should never be a luxury, it should be something to count on, right in your neighborhood. These kiosks are about making things easier, safer, more accessible to people who may not always have the time or the means to get to a hospital or to an urgent care.”

author: Angeloumbsh Pages
title: The 5-Second Trick For Search Engine Algorithms
text:
The Importance of Quality Content Creation for Businesses:
Superior content is not only a tool for attracting and retaining customers; it's a key component of building a brand's image and reputation. When a business invests in creating informative, engaging, and relevant content, it communicates its expertise, values, and dedication to customer needs. This effort builds trust and credibility among prospective customers, motivating them to engage more deeply with the brand.
Furthermore, quality content boosts SEO efforts, driving organic traffic to the business's website. By incorporating relevant keywords, addressing current topics, and providing valuable insights, businesses can improve their search engine rankings, making them more visible to potential customers.
In the digital age, content serves as a medium for businesses to share their story, share their knowledge, and connect with their audience on a personal level. This connection is crucial for customer loyalty and brand advocacy, as customers are more likely to endorse and recommend brands they trust and feel connected to.
Ultimately, quality content can also be utilized across various platforms – from blogs and social media posts to ebooks and webinars – maximizing its reach and effectiveness. This strategic use of content not only boosts brand visibility but also offers a comprehensive and uniform brand experience for the audience.
SEO writing strives to achieve high rankings in search engine results. It involves meticulous keyword research and optimized content creation that aligns with user intent. Understanding Google’s algorithm and finding the right keywords are essential. The content should be written for humans first, ensuring readability and value, and it should avoid keyword stuffing.
Meta Description Examples and Tips.
SEO Writing:
SEO writing is an art that combines the complexity of search engine optimization with the innovation of content creation. It's about crafting content that not only appeals to search engines but also provides genuine value to readers. The process starts with thorough keyword research, identifying terms and phrases that potential customers are using to find information online. But it's not only about inserting keywords into content; it's about creating insightful, engaging, and readable pieces that organically incorporate these keywords. This approach ensures that the content resonates with both search engines for better rankings and with readers for better engagement and retention.
Meta Description Tips:
Meta descriptions act as brief previews in search engine results, describing what users can expect from the webpage. An effective meta description is brief, typically around 155 characters, and includes a clear call to action. It should accurately reflect the content of the page while also being enticing enough to encourage clicks. Incorporating primary keywords into your meta description can also be beneficial, as this can help enhance the page's visibility in search results. However, the key is to balance keyword inclusion with a fluid and compelling narrative that entices the reader to want to learn more.
Meta descriptions provide a brief preview of a page’s content on search engine results pages (SERPs). They are crucial for guiding users on what to expect when visiting a web page. Optimized meta descriptions can increase a business’s organic traffic. They are an integral aspect of SEO, influencing click-through rates (CTRs) and indirectly affecting rankings.
Local SEO: Boosting Your Business:
Local SEO improves online presence for local search results, reaching potential customers in a specific geographic area. It involves optimizing Google My Business profiles, online directories, and website content. Local SEO is crucial as more people use search engines to find local businesses, with a high conversion rate and strong purchase intent.
Improving Domain Authority:
Domain Authority (DA) measures a website's strength and relevance in a specific subject area. It's assessed using factors like MozRank, link profile, and site structure. Improving DA involves
Keyword Difficulty Assessment creating top-tier content, establishing links from reputable websites, and optimizing website structure and user experience.
Technical SEO: Basics and Best Practices:
Technical SEO improves a website's technical structure for better search engine visibility. It includes tasks like optimizing site structure, increasing website speed, ensuring mobile-friendliness, and addressing duplicate content issues. Key practices include securing the site with HTTPS, optimizing website versions, enhancing page speed, and ensuring mobile-friendliness.
Content Optimization for Brand SEO:
Content optimization improves visibility and search engine rankings, driving traffic to websites and social media platforms. It involves internal links, keywords, meta tags, URLs, and readability. Regular content audits, competitor research, and attention to technical aspects like title tags and meta descriptions are critical for effective content optimization.
Effective Keyword Research for SEO:
Keyword research is finding valuable search queries that potential customers use in search engines. It's essential for driving targeted visitors to your website. The process includes brainstorming seed keywords, using keyword research tools, and considering keyword metrics like search volume, difficulty, and relevance.
These insights provide a comprehensive understanding of various digital marketing and SEO strategies, emphasizing the importance of quality content, effective SEO practices, understanding and optimizing for local SEO, enhancing domain authority, mastering technical SEO, optimizing content for brand visibility, and conducting effective keyword research.

author: Sonia Meneses
title: Gomita se pone exigente en su carta a los Reyes Magos para pedir un novio
text:
A poco de celebrar el Día de Reyes -6 de enero-,
Gomita se puso exigente en su carta a los Reyes Magos para pedir un novio.
Y es que en un video, Gomita -de 29 años de edad- reveló las características que le gustarían en su regalo.
El video de Gomita rápidamente comenzó a hacerse viral, y es que ella no sería la única en pensar de esa manera.
Así pidió Gomita a su novio en su carta a los Reyes Magos
A través de su cuenta oficial en TikTok, Gomita -@gomita_aficial- compartió un video haciendo su carta a los Reyes Magos
Y a pesar de haber señalado durante un encuentro con la prensa que no se quería enamorar en el 2024, Gomita reveló que en su carta pidió un novio.
Sin embargo, en en su carta a los Reyes Magos la influencer se puso exigente con las características que su novio tenía que tener.
Pues en esta carta Gomita detalló que, como en la canción ‘Perro Fiel’ de Shakira -de 46 años de edad-, que quería que su novio fuera:
“Quiero un tipo atento y cariñoso Pero que no sea muy celoso Que en la calle sea un príncipe Pero que en mi cama sea salvaje y peligroso”‘Perro Fiel’ de Shakira
El TikTok de Gomita rápidamente comenzó a hacerse viral, y es que ella no sería la única en la plataforma que piensa de esa manera.
Gomita no estaría buscando novio para el 2024
A pesar de que Gomita pidió un novio en su carta a los Reyes Magos, durante un encuentro con la prensa antes de Año Nuevo, la influencer reveló que no se quería enamorara en el 2024.
Y es que de acuerdo con Gomita, haber intentado enamorarse durante el 2023 fue uno de los actos que más lecciones le brindó.
Pues su exnovio, al cual mantuvo en el anonimato y con el cual se habría comprometido, terminó con ella debido a que “no estaba para una relación” formal.
El noviazgo de Gomita tuvo una duración de 4 meses, tomando en cuenta el tiempo que se estuvieron conociendo.

author: TTV
title: 驚！大雨釀三峽台111線道「土石崩落」　雙向封閉
text:
2025.05.08 09:27 疑似近日豪大雨造成邊坡土石鬆動。圖／台視新聞 新北市三峽山區北111縣道2.5公里至3公里處，今（8）日清晨驚傳土石崩落！疑似近日豪大雨造成邊坡土石鬆動，落石與土方傾斜而下，讓通往山區道路雙向受阻，大量土石堆滿整個車道，還砸毀了一旁的護欄。
休假員警當時剛好路過要回派出所，看到大塊土石崩落，也立刻通報，區公所及養工處中和工務段派員搶修。至於是否有人車受困，還需要進一步了解，也呼籲要經過這段道路的民眾提早改道。
三峽台111線道土石崩落。圖／台視新聞 責任編輯／網路中心
